text:
Signs of nonmelanoma skin cancer include the following:         - A sore that does not heal.    - Areas of the skin that are:               - Raised, smooth, shiny, and look pearly.       - Firm and look like a scar, and may be white, yellow, or waxy.      - Raised, and red or reddish-brown.       - Scaly, bleeding or crusty.",CancerGov,Skin Cancer
Who is at risk for Skin Cancer? ?,"Skin color and being exposed to sunlight can increase the risk of nonmelanoma skin cancer and actinic keratosis.
